page.title: 10MODDERSHALL,THE VILLAGE
page.content: After Fulford, Moddershall is the second largest village in our area.It is situated 2 Km. to the south west of Fulford. The population census of 1981 gives the village a total of 185.There are only 72 dwellings,12 of which are council houses,one of which has been sold privately. There are few amenities here apart from :- public house, public phone box, village hall,sports club,pensioners club,riding stables.There are five buses a day which come from Stone and terminate in Longton.Moddershall is a dormitory village for the Potteries. Historically the Moddershall valley had a number of flint grinding mills one of which was sited next to the Boar Inn.Ground flint was supplied to the pottery industry to mix with the clay.
